messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Why it's okay for Heidi to be on the computer a lot ...
messages.msgSnippet: Yes yes I too have found this world FITS and it feels great I have come to accept myself as different but the lack of Adult Stimulation frustrated me, here all
messages.messageBody:
Yes yes
I too have found this world FITS
and it feels great
I have come to accept myself as different but the lack of Adult Stimulation
frustrated me, here all I have to do is read
Thanks Everyone
Joan
Mother At Home
Home Educator


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Why it's okay for Heidi to be on the computer a lot ...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 05/05/2003 18:35:23 Pacific Daylight Time, ... Oh Sandra, thank you for your answer to Heidi, it spoke to me completely. I have few friends
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 05/05/2003 18:35:23 Pacific Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:


> If this satisfies your urge for female company sometimes, it keeps you from
> having to leave the kids or from having to pay for expensive coffee and
> snacks at some hoity-toity bakery/magazine stand.
>

Oh Sandra, thank you for your answer to Heidi, it spoke to me completely. I
have few friends that I see regularly, Maureen is the only one really
unschooling, and your answer to Heidi just addressed a guilty secret of mine,
that this list is my only social life! I look forward to it each evening, to
see what everyone is doing, and to hear the latest. Even when the traffic was
VERY high with a bit of weird stuff thrown in, I couldn't wait. Once again
you have relieved me of the burden of believing I should be spending my time
in a better way.
THANK YOU
Nancy in BC, shivering under a blanket.
PS, Heidi, I am right there with you !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
